name: v12.0.0
body:
# Breaking changes

* [Move to com.netflix namespace for plugin id](https://github.com/nebula-plugins/nebula-dependency-recommender-plugin/commit/9eee5276a099e3b85cb93cd7e761868b6e2c566b)

name: v11.0.0
body: # Breaking Change. Gradle 7 support

name: v10.0.0
body: Remove usage of deprecated APIs removed in Gradle 7.0. Minimum required Gradle 6.1.

name: v9.1.1
body: Apply core BOM platforms to all configurations ending with `annotationPreprocessor`.

name: v9.1.0
body: When using `nebula.features.coreBomSupport=true` Gradle platforms are applied only to `*Classpath` and `annotationPreprocessor` configurations. It means applied platforms are not part of published metadata from the module or part of the output when consuming modules withing a multi-module project.

name: v9.0.2
body: Fix a bug when a recommendation BOM was provided only in the root module we haven't seen reasons in dependency insight of a submodule for recommended dependencies.

name: v9.0.1-rc.1
body: Refactoring to support Gradle 6.1

name: v9.0.0
body: * make sure we do not apply recommendations for provided versions by Gradle

name: v8.2.0
body: Mark copied configurations as non-resolvable so that we do not lock copies of BOM configurations with core Gradle locking
support for `excludeConfigurationPrefixes` in recommender extension

name: v7.4.0
body: Enable APIs for reading a writing Maven BOMs even when `nebula.features.coreBomSupport`. It allows us publishing of aggregated BOMs even with `coreBomSupport`.

name: v7.3.0
body: When using `nebula.features.coreBomSupport` feature flag enabled. You can specify `mavenBom` with an enforced flag which will use Gradle `enforcedPlatform` for forcing all dependencies from BOM.

name: v7.2.2
body:
Add Guava as dependency to fix https://github.com/nebula-plugins/nebula-dependency-recommender-plugin/issues/98 

```
* What went wrong:
An exception occurred applying plugin request [id: 'nebula.dependency-recommender', version: '7.2.1']
> Failed to apply plugin [id 'nebula.dependency-recommender']
   > Could not create an instance of type netflix.nebula.dependency.recommender.provider.RecommendationProviderContainer_Decorated.
      > com/google/common/base/Supplier

```

name: v7.2.1
body: Exclude configurations for tools like `findbug`, `cobertura`, `spotbugs`, `jacoco` from recommendation.

name: v7.2.0
body: Upgrade plugins

name: v7.1.2
body: Ignore already resolved configurations when we are inserting BOM into them

name: v7.1.1
body: Add `protolock` configuration on the list of ignored configurations for experimental BOM support.

name: v7.1.0
body: Fix `nebulaRecommenderBom` support for Gradle 5 +

name: v7.0.1
body: Use explicit platform for experimental Core BOM support.

Breaking change
===

Support only for Gradle 4.0+

name: v6.1.4
body: Exclude `bootArchives`, `webapp` configurations from including boms with recommendation.

name: v6.1.3
body: Make BOM generation non-lenient again. We could miss dependencies due to transient failures in a resolution process which were silently ignored.

name: v6.1.2
body: Exclude `versionManagement`, `resolutionRules` configurations from including boms with recommendation.

name: v6.1.1
body: Support `dependencyRecommendations.excludeConfigurations([])` with the `nebula.features.coreBomSupport` feature flag enabled.

name: v6.1.0
body: Support feature-flagged implementation that delegates `mavenBom module:` syntax to [Gradle's IMPROVED_POM_SUPPORT](https://docs.gradle.org/4.6/release-notes.html#bom-import). Other implementations (properties, map, etc) fail when this flag is enabled.

name: v6.0.0
body:
Use Gradle's core dependency insight to add dependency details

Removes nebula-dependency-base-plugin

This project will now use Gradle 4.9 or higher to use it's improved dependency insight

name: v6.0.0-rc.1
body:
Use Gradle's core dependency insight to add dependency details

Removes nebula-dependency-base-plugin

This project will now use Gradle 4.9-rc-1 or higher to use it's improved dependency insight

name: v5.2.0
body: Make BOM generation lenient, so that missing dependencies are tolerated

name: v5.1.1
body: Fix thread safety issue in Maven BOM provider which could cause recommendations to be missing on some projects during a parallel build.

name: v5.1.0
body:
* Merged in addition of a reader that can handle comments in the bom files from ash211
* Merged in thread safety for glob ininitialization from billbindi
* Merged in doc update to note plugin must be applied to root project from jmcampanini
* Move a lot of logging to debug
* Fix possible NPE if a bom doesn't have a `dependencyManagement` section
* Gradle 4.4

name: v5.0.0
body:
This release provides compatibility with composite builds, with some caveats:

- Dependencies from composites are resolved as substituted project dependencies, so recommendations need to be declared in the project including a build with recommendations
- Both the `ConflictResolved` and `OverrideTransitives` strategies now always apply recommendations to dependencies without versions, as they can't inspect substituted composite projects to determine their first order dependencies
- The `OverrideTransitives` strategy will treat effective first order dependencies from composite projects as transitive dependencies

name: v4.5.0
body: Use detached configurations to resolve the Maven model so dependencies are cached and --offline is supported.

name: v4.4.0
body: Expose Maven BOM provider on provider container and recommendations map to allow recommendation publishers to merge Maven recommendation sources

name: v4.3.0
body:
* Allow configurations to be ignored via Jarek Lewandowski/jotel
* Handle maven repos that require credentials via Tomasz Jędrzejewski zyxist and Stephan Pauxberger/pauxus
* *BUGFIX* remove possible infinite loop on creation of a bom

name: v4.2.1
body: *BUGFIX* Allow profiles and similar things to be resolved in maven boms

name: v4.2.0
body: Add a `strictMode` flag

name: v4.1.2
body: Use the new `nebula-gradle-interop` library to provide Gradle 3.6 nightly compatibility

name: v4.1.1
body: Prevent substituted dependencies by having their version replaced by recommendation (#49)

name: v4.1.0
body: * use `nebula.dependency-base` to add `dependencyInsightEnhanced`

name: v4.0.2
body: Remove `getProjectConfiguration` deprecation warning on Gradle 3.4

name: v4.0.1
body: Close `InputStream` for properties and file based providers to avoid file locking issues on Windows

name: v4.0.0
body: BREAKING: Change to ConflictResolvedStrategy. First order recommendations will not auto-win they will go through conflict resolution.

name: v3.7.0
body:
- Add `nebulaRecommenderBom` configuration for pom based boms
- Shift `mavenBom` calls in the plugin extension to add the bom to the configuration

name: v3.6.3
body: - _BUGFIX_ handle recommendations across a multiproject where subproject B depends on A which has a dependency it needs to pick up from recommendations

name: v3.6.2
body: Evaluate dependencies for BOM publishing only when `withXml` is called, preventing dependency resolution when the publications container is evaluated

name: v3.6.1
body: Don't run recommendations providers unless a recommendation will be needed. Avoids interactions with publishing due to `getProperties` call on the project (@ `netflix.nebula.dependency.recommender.provider.MavenBomRecommendationProvider$ProjectPropertiesModelInterpolator.createValueSources(MavenBomRecommendationProvider.java:137`)

name: v3.6.0
body: Renames the `dependencyManagement` publishing extension to `nebulaDependencyManagement` to avoid conflicts with Spring dependency management plugin

name: v3.5.0
body: Apply all plugin logic inside a single `incoming.beforeResolve` block so ordering is predictable when interacting with other plugins

name: v3.2.0
body: - Handle gradle-dependency-lock V4 format

name: v3.1.0
body:
- Offer two strategies for how recommendations interact with transitive dependencies:
  - `ConflictResolved` - If there is no first order recommend-able dependency, a transitive will conflict resolve with dependencies in the recommendations listing
  - `OverrideTransitives` - If a recommendation conflicts with a transitive, pick the transitive

name: v3.0.3
body: Fixed bug where GString inputs to Maven BOM and Ivy module attribute were not appended with the file type
Add a dependency on maven-module-builder which Gradle is now shading.
